1.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

near, with or among; often in general, to
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a present (as offered up), especially in sacrifice or as tribute
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to impel; hence, to volunteer (as a soldier), to present spontaneously
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to take (in the widest variety of applications)

silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
copper, hence, something made of that metal, i.e. coin, a fetter; figuratively, base (as compared with gold or silver)

4.brief: the cerulean mussel, i.e. the color (violet) obtained therefrom or stuff dyed therewith
purple (the color or the dyed stuff)
the crimson-grub, but used only (in this connection) of the colorfrom it, and cloths dyed therewith
crimson, properly, the insect or its color, also stuff dyed with it
bleached stuff, i.e. white linen or (by analogy) marble
a she-goat (as strong), but masculine in plural (which also is used elliptically for goat's hair)

5.brief: skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
properly, strength; hence, anything strong; specifically a chief (politically); also a ram (from his strength); a pilaster (as a strong support); an oak or other strong tree
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
a (clean) animal with fur, probably a species of antelope
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)

6.brief: grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
properly, a luminous body or luminary, i.e. (abstractly) light (as an element); figuratively, brightness, i.e.cheerfulness; specifically, a chandelier
fragrance; by implication, spicery; also the balsam plant
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
unction (the act); by implication, a consecratory gift

7.brief: a gem, probably the beryl (from its pale green color)
a fulfilling (only in plural), i.e. (literally) a setting (of gems), or (technically) consecration (also concretely, a dedicatory sacrifice)
a girdle; specifically the ephod or highpriest's shoulder-piece; also generally, an image
perhaps a pocket (as holding the Urim and Thummim), or rich (as containing gems), used only of the gorget of the highpriest

to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

36.brief: a chaplet; but used only in an architectonic sense, i.e. the capital of acolumn, or a wreath-like button or disk on the candelabrum
a reed (as erect); by resemblance a rod (especially for measuring), shaft, tube, stem, the radius (of the arm), beam (of a steelyard)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
rounded work, i.e. moulded by hammering (repousse)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense)

37.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively)
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively)
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a region across; but used only adverbially (with or without a preposition) on the opposite side (especially of the Jordan; ususally meaning the east)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

38.brief: gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense)

39.brief: a circle, i.e. (by implication) a circumjacent tract or region, especially the Ghor or valley of the Jordan; also a (round) loaf; also a talent (or large [round] coin)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
structure; by implication, a model, resemblance
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
